15#define DST_DST_H 1
16
17/*! \file dst/dst.h */
18
19#include <inttypes.h>
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/stdtime.h>
24
25#include <dns/types.h>
26#include <dns/log.h>
27#include <dns/name.h>
28#include <dns/secalg.h>
29#include <dns/ds.h>
30#include <dns/dsdigest.h>
31
32#include <dst/gssapi.h>

34ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
35
36/***
37 *** Types
38 ***/
39
40/*%
41 * The dst_key structure is opaque. Applications should use the accessor
42 * functions provided to retrieve key attributes. If an application needs
43 * to set attributes, new accessor functions will be written.
44 */
45
46typedef struct dst_key dst_key_t;
47typedef struct dst_context dst_context_t;
48
49/* DST algorithm codes */
50#define DST_ALG_UNKNOWN 0
51#define DST_ALG_RSA 1 /* Used for parsing RSASHA1, RSASHA256 and RSASHA512 */
52#define DST_ALG_RSAMD5 1
53#define DST_ALG_DH 2
54#define DST_ALG_DSA 3
55#define DST_ALG_ECC 4
56#define DST_ALG_RSASHA1 5
57#define DST_ALG_NSEC3DSA 6
58#define DST_ALG_NSEC3RSASHA1 7
59#define DST_ALG_RSASHA256 8
60#define DST_ALG_RSASHA512 10
61#define DST_ALG_ECCGOST 12
62#define DST_ALG_ECDSA256 13
63#define DST_ALG_ECDSA384 14
64#define DST_ALG_ED25519 15
65#define DST_ALG_ED448 16
66#define DST_ALG_HMACMD5 157
67#define DST_ALG_GSSAPI 160
68#define DST_ALG_HMACSHA1 161 /* XXXMPA */
69#define DST_ALG_HMACSHA224 162 /* XXXMPA */
70#define DST_ALG_HMACSHA256 163 /* XXXMPA */
71#define DST_ALG_HMACSHA384 164 /* XXXMPA */
72#define DST_ALG_HMACSHA512 165 /* XXXMPA */
73#define DST_ALG_INDIRECT 252
74#define DST_ALG_PRIVATE 254
75#define DST_MAX_ALGS 256
76
77/*% A buffer of this size is large enough to hold any key */
78#define DST_KEY_MAXSIZE 1280
79
80/*%
81 * A buffer of this size is large enough to hold the textual representation
82 * of any key
83 */
84#define DST_KEY_MAXTEXTSIZE 2048
85
86/*% 'Type' for dst_read_key() */
87#define DST_TYPE_KEY 0x1000000 /* KEY key */
88#define DST_TYPE_PRIVATE 0x2000000
89#define DST_TYPE_PUBLIC 0x4000000
90
91/* Key timing metadata definitions */
92#define DST_TIME_CREATED 0
93#define DST_TIME_PUBLISH 1
94#define DST_TIME_ACTIVATE 2
95#define DST_TIME_REVOKE 3
96#define DST_TIME_INACTIVE 4
97#define DST_TIME_DELETE 5
98#define DST_TIME_DSPUBLISH 6
99#define DST_TIME_SYNCPUBLISH 7
100#define DST_TIME_SYNCDELETE 8
101#define DST_MAX_TIMES 8
102
103/* Numeric metadata definitions */
104#define DST_NUM_PREDECESSOR 0
105#define DST_NUM_SUCCESSOR 1
106#define DST_NUM_MAXTTL 2
107#define DST_NUM_ROLLPERIOD 3
108#define DST_MAX_NUMERIC 3
109
110/*
111 * Current format version number of the private key parser.
112 *
113 * When parsing a key file with the same major number but a higher minor
114 * number, the key parser will ignore any fields it does not recognize.
115 * Thus, DST_MINOR_VERSION should be incremented whenever new
116 * fields are added to the private key file (such as new metadata).
117 *
118 * When rewriting these keys, those fields will be dropped, and the
119 * format version set back to the current one..
120 *
121 * When a key is seen with a higher major number, the key parser will
122 * reject it as invalid. Thus, DST_MAJOR_VERSION should be incremented
123 * and DST_MINOR_VERSION set to zero whenever there is a format change
124 * which is not backward compatible to previous versions of the dst_key
125 * parser, such as change in the syntax of an existing field, the removal
126 * of a currently mandatory field, or a new field added which would
127 * alter the functioning of the key if it were absent.
128 */
129#define DST_MAJOR_VERSION 1
130#define DST_MINOR_VERSION 3
131
132/***
133 *** Functions
134 ***/
135isc_result_t
136dst_lib_init(isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *engine);
137/*%<
138 * Initializes the DST subsystem.
139 *
140 * Requires:
141 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context
142 *
143 * Returns:
144 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
145 * \li ISC_R_NOMEMORY
146 * \li DST_R_NOENGINE
147 *
148 * Ensures:
149 * \li DST is properly initialized.
150 */
151
152void
153dst_lib_destroy(void);
154/*%<
155 * Releases all resources allocated by DST.
156 */
157
158bool
159dst_algorithm_supported(unsigned int alg);
160/*%<
161 * Checks that a given algorithm is supported by DST.
162 *
163 * Returns:
164 * \li true
165 * \li false
166 */
167
168bool
169dst_ds_digest_supported(unsigned int digest_type);
170/*%<
171 * Checks that a given digest algorithm is supported by DST.
172 *
173 * Returns:
174 * \li true
175 * \li false
176 */
177
178isc_result_t
179dst_context_create(dst_key_t *key, isc_mem_t *mctx,
180 isc_logcategory_t *category, bool useforsigning,
181 int maxbits, dst_context_t **dctxp);
182/*%<
183 * Creates a context to be used for a sign or verify operation.
184 *
185 * Requires:
186 * \li "key" is a valid key.
187 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
188 * \li dctxp != NULL && *dctxp == NULL
189 *
190 * Returns:
191 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
192 * \li ISC_R_NOMEMORY
193 *
194 * Ensures:
195 * \li *dctxp will contain a usable context.
196 */
197
198void
199dst_context_destroy(dst_context_t **dctxp);
200/*%<
201 * Destroys all memory associated with a context.
202 *
203 * Requires:
204 * \li *dctxp != NULL && *dctxp == NULL
205 *
206 * Ensures:
207 * \li *dctxp == NULL
208 */
209
210isc_result_t
211dst_context_adddata(dst_context_t *dctx, const isc_region_t *data);
212/*%<
213 * Incrementally adds data to the context to be used in a sign or verify
214 * operation.
215 *
216 * Requires:
217 * \li "dctx" is a valid context
218 * \li "data" is a valid region
219 *
220 * Returns:
221 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
222 * \li DST_R_SIGNFAILURE
223 * \li all other errors indicate failure
224 */
225
226isc_result_t
227dst_context_sign(dst_context_t *dctx, isc_buffer_t *sig);
228/*%<
229 * Computes a signature using the data and key stored in the context.
230 *
231 * Requires:
232 * \li "dctx" is a valid context.
233 * \li "sig" is a valid buffer.
234 *
235 * Returns:
236 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
237 * \li DST_R_VERIFYFAILURE
238 * \li all other errors indicate failure
239 *
240 * Ensures:
241 * \li "sig" will contain the signature
242 */
243
244isc_result_t
245dst_context_verify(dst_context_t *dctx, isc_region_t *sig);
246
247isc_result_t
248dst_context_verify2(dst_context_t *dctx, unsigned int maxbits,
249 isc_region_t *sig);
250/*%<
251 * Verifies the signature using the data and key stored in the context.
252 *
253 * 'maxbits' specifies the maximum number of bits permitted in the RSA
254 * exponent.
255 *
256 * Requires:
257 * \li "dctx" is a valid context.
258 * \li "sig" is a valid region.
259 *
260 * Returns:
261 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
262 * \li all other errors indicate failure
263 *
264 * Ensures:
265 * \li "sig" will contain the signature
266 */
267
268isc_result_t
269dst_key_computesecret(const dst_key_t *pub, const dst_key_t *priv,
270 isc_buffer_t *secret);
271/*%<
272 * Computes a shared secret from two (Diffie-Hellman) keys.
273 *
274 * Requires:
275 * \li "pub" is a valid key that can be used to derive a shared secret
276 * \li "priv" is a valid private key that can be used to derive a shared secret
277 * \li "secret" is a valid buffer
278 *
279 * Returns:
280 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
281 * \li any other result indicates failure
282 *
283 * Ensures:
284 * \li If successful, secret will contain the derived shared secret.
285 */
286
287isc_result_t
288dst_key_getfilename(dns_name_t *name, dns_keytag_t id, unsigned int alg,
289 int type, const char *directory,
290 isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_buffer_t *buf);
291/*%<
292 * Generates a key filename for the name, algorithm, and
293 * id, and places it in the buffer 'buf'. If directory is NULL, the
294 * current directory is assumed.
295 *
296 * Requires:
297 * \li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
298 * \li "id" is a valid key tag identifier.
299 * \li "alg" is a supported key algorithm.
300 * \li "type" is DST_TYPE_PUBLIC, DST_TYPE_PRIVATE, or the bitwise union.
301 * DST_TYPE_KEY look for a KEY record otherwise DNSKEY
302 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
303 * \li "buf" is not NULL.
304 *
305 * Returns:
306 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
307 * \li any other result indicates failure
308 */
309
310isc_result_t
311dst_key_fromfile(dns_name_t *name, dns_keytag_t id, unsigned int alg, int type,
312 const char *directory, isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
313/*%<
314 * Reads a key from permanent storage. The key can either be a public or
315 * private key, and is specified by name, algorithm, and id. If a private key
316 * is specified, the public key must also be present. If directory is NULL,
317 * the current directory is assumed.
318 *
319 * Requires:
320 * \li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
321 * \li "id" is a valid key tag identifier.
322 * \li "alg" is a supported key algorithm.
323 * \li "type" is DST_TYPE_PUBLIC, DST_TYPE_PRIVATE, or the bitwise union.
324 * DST_TYPE_KEY look for a KEY record otherwise DNSKEY
325 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
326 * \li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
327 *
328 * Returns:
329 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
330 * \li any other result indicates failure
331 *
332 * Ensures:
333 * \li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key.
334 */
335
336isc_result_t
337dst_key_fromnamedfile(const char *filename, const char *dirname,
338 int type, isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
339/*%<
340 * Reads a key from permanent storage. The key can either be a public or
341 * key, and is specified by filename. If a private key is specified, the
342 * public key must also be present.
343 *
344 * If 'dirname' is not NULL, and 'filename' is a relative path,
345 * then the file is looked up relative to the given directory.
346 * If 'filename' is an absolute path, 'dirname' is ignored.
347 *
348 * Requires:
349 * \li "filename" is not NULL
350 * \li "type" is DST_TYPE_PUBLIC, DST_TYPE_PRIVATE, or the bitwise union
351 * DST_TYPE_KEY look for a KEY record otherwise DNSKEY
352 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context
353 * \li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
354 *
355 * Returns:
356 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
357 * \li any other result indicates failure
358 *
359 * Ensures:
360 * \li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key.
361 */
362
363
364isc_result_t
365dst_key_read_public(const char *filename, int type,
366 isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
367/*%<
368 * Reads a public key from permanent storage. The key must be a public key.
369 *
370 * Requires:
371 * \li "filename" is not NULL
372 * \li "type" is DST_TYPE_KEY look for a KEY record otherwise DNSKEY
373 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context
374 * \li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
375 *
376 * Returns:
377 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
378 * \li DST_R_BADKEYTYPE if the key type is not the expected one
379 * \li ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDTOKEN if the file can not be parsed as a public key
380 * \li any other result indicates failure
381 *
382 * Ensures:
383 * \li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key.
384 */
385
386isc_result_t
387dst_key_tofile(const dst_key_t *key, int type, const char *directory);
388/*%<
389 * Writes a key to permanent storage. The key can either be a public or
390 * private key. Public keys are written in DNS format and private keys
391 * are written as a set of base64 encoded values. If directory is NULL,
392 * the current directory is assumed.
393 *
394 * Requires:
395 * \li "key" is a valid key.
396 * \li "type" is DST_TYPE_PUBLIC, DST_TYPE_PRIVATE, or the bitwise union
397 *
398 * Returns:
399 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
400 * \li any other result indicates failure
401 */
402
403isc_result_t
404dst_key_fromdns(const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
405 isc_buffer_t *source, isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
406/*%<
407 * Converts a DNS KEY record into a DST key.
408 *
409 * Requires:
410 * \li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
411 * \li "source" is a valid buffer. There must be at least 4 bytes available.
412 * \li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
413 * \li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
414 *
415 * Returns:
416 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
417 * \li any other result indicates failure
418 *
419 * Ensures:
420 * \li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key, and the consumed
421 * pointer in data will be advanced.
422 */
423
424isc_result_t
425dst_key_todns(const dst_key_t *key, isc_buffer_t *target);
426/*%<
427 * Converts a DST key into a DNS KEY record.
428 *
429 * Requires:
430 * \li "key" is a valid key.
431 * \li "target" is a valid buffer. There must be at least 4 bytes unused.
432 *
433 * Returns:
434 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
435 * \li any other result indicates failure
436 *
437 * Ensures:
438 * \li If successful, the used pointer in 'target' is advanced by at least 4.
439 */
440
441isc_result_t
442dst_key_frombuffer(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg,
443 unsigned int flags, unsigned int protocol,
444 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
445 isc_buffer_t *source, isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
446/*%<
447 * Converts a buffer containing DNS KEY RDATA into a DST key.
448 *
449 * Requires:
450 *\li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
451 *\li "alg" is a supported key algorithm.
452 *\li "source" is a valid buffer.
453 *\li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
454 *\li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
455 *
456 * Returns:
457 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
458 * \li any other result indicates failure
459 *
460 * Ensures:
461 *\li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key, and the consumed
462 * pointer in source will be advanced.
463 */
464
465isc_result_t
466dst_key_tobuffer(const dst_key_t *key, isc_buffer_t *target);
467/*%<
468 * Converts a DST key into DNS KEY RDATA format.
469 *
470 * Requires:
471 *\li "key" is a valid key.
472 *\li "target" is a valid buffer.
473 *
474 * Returns:
475 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
476 * \li any other result indicates failure
477 *
478 * Ensures:
479 *\li If successful, the used pointer in 'target' is advanced.
480 */
481
482isc_result_t
483dst_key_privatefrombuffer(dst_key_t *key, isc_buffer_t *buffer);
484/*%<
485 * Converts a public key into a private key, reading the private key
486 * information from the buffer. The buffer should contain the same data
487 * as the .private key file would.
488 *
489 * Requires:
490 *\li "key" is a valid public key.
491 *\li "buffer" is not NULL.
492 *
493 * Returns:
494 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
495 * \li any other result indicates failure
496 *
497 * Ensures:
498 *\li If successful, key will contain a valid private key.
499 */
500
501gss_ctx_id_t
502dst_key_getgssctx(const dst_key_t *key);
503/*%<
504 * Returns the opaque key data.
505 * Be cautions when using this value unless you know what you are doing.
506 *
507 * Requires:
508 *\li "key" is not NULL.
509 *
510 * Returns:
511 *\li gssctx key data, possibly NULL.
512 */
513
514isc_result_t
515dst_key_fromgssapi(const dns_name_t *name, gss_ctx_id_t gssctx, isc_mem_t *mctx,
516 dst_key_t **keyp, isc_region_t *intoken);
517/*%<
518 * Converts a GSSAPI opaque context id into a DST key.
519 *
520 * Requires:
521 *\li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
522 *\li "gssctx" is a GSSAPI context id.
523 *\li "mctx" is a valid memory context.
524 *\li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
525 *
526 * Returns:
527 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
528 * \li any other result indicates failure
529 *
530 * Ensures:
531 *\li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key and be responsible for
532 * the context id.
533 */
534
535#ifdef DST_KEY_INTERNAL
536isc_result_t
537dst_key_buildinternal(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg,
538 unsigned int bits, unsigned int flags,
539 unsigned int protocol, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
540 void *data, isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
541#endif
542
543isc_result_t
544dst_key_fromlabel(const dns_name_t *name, int alg, unsigned int flags,
545 unsigned int protocol, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
546 const char *engine, const char *label, const char *pin,
547 isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp);
548
549isc_result_t
550dst_key_generate(const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg,
551 unsigned int bits, unsigned int param,
552 unsigned int flags, unsigned int protocol,
553 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
554 isc_mem_t *mctx, dst_key_t **keyp,
555 void (*callback)(int));
556
557/*%<
558 * Generate a DST key (or keypair) with the supplied parameters. The
559 * interpretation of the "param" field depends on the algorithm:
560 * \code
561 * RSA: exponent
562 * 0 use exponent 3
563 * !0 use Fermat4 (2^16 + 1)
564 * DH: generator
565 * 0 default - use well known prime if bits == 768 or 1024,
566 * otherwise use 2 as the generator.
567 * !0 use this value as the generator.
568 * DSA: unused
569 * HMACMD5: entropy
570 * 0 default - require good entropy
571 * !0 lack of good entropy is ok
572 *\endcode
573 *
574 * Requires:
575 *\li "name" is a valid absolute dns name.
576 *\li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is NULL.
577 *
578 * Returns:
579 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
580 * \li any other result indicates failure
581 *
582 * Ensures:
583 *\li If successful, *keyp will contain a valid key.
584 */
585
586bool
587dst_key_compare(const dst_key_t *key1, const dst_key_t *key2);
588/*%<
589 * Compares two DST keys. Returns true if they match, false otherwise.
590 *
591 * Keys ARE NOT considered to match if one of them is the revoked version
592 * of the other.
593 *
594 * Requires:
595 *\li "key1" is a valid key.
596 *\li "key2" is a valid key.
597 *
598 * Returns:
599 *\li true
600 * \li false
601 */
602
603bool
604dst_key_pubcompare(const dst_key_t *key1, const dst_key_t *key2,
605 bool match_revoked_key);
606/*%<
607 * Compares only the public portions of two DST keys. Returns true
608 * if they match, false otherwise. This allows us, for example, to
609 * determine whether a public key found in a zone matches up with a
610 * key pair found on disk.
611 *
612 * If match_revoked_key is TRUE, then keys ARE considered to match if one
613 * of them is the revoked version of the other. Otherwise, they are not.
614 *
615 * Requires:
616 *\li "key1" is a valid key.
617 *\li "key2" is a valid key.
618 *
619 * Returns:
620 *\li true
621 * \li false
622 */
623
624bool
625dst_key_paramcompare(const dst_key_t *key1, const dst_key_t *key2);
626/*%<
627 * Compares the parameters of two DST keys. This is used to determine if
628 * two (Diffie-Hellman) keys can be used to derive a shared secret.
629 *
630 * Requires:
631 *\li "key1" is a valid key.
632 *\li "key2" is a valid key.
633 *
634 * Returns:
635 *\li true
636 * \li false
637 */
638
639void
640dst_key_attach(dst_key_t *source, dst_key_t **target);
641/*
642 * Attach to a existing key increasing the reference count.
643 *
644 * Requires:
645 *\li 'source' to be a valid key.
646 *\li 'target' to be non-NULL and '*target' to be NULL.
647 */
648
649void
650dst_key_free(dst_key_t **keyp);
651/*%<
652 * Decrement the key's reference counter and, when it reaches zero,
653 * release all memory associated with the key.
654 *
655 * Requires:
656 *\li "keyp" is not NULL and "*keyp" is a valid key.
657 *\li reference counter greater than zero.
658 *
659 * Ensures:
660 *\li All memory associated with "*keyp" will be freed.
661 *\li *keyp == NULL
662 */
663
664/*%<
665 * Accessor functions to obtain key fields.
666 *
667 * Require:
668 *\li "key" is a valid key.
669 */
670dns_name_t *
671dst_key_name(const dst_key_t *key);
672
673unsigned int
674dst_key_size(const dst_key_t *key);
675
676unsigned int
677dst_key_proto(const dst_key_t *key);
678
679unsigned int
680dst_key_alg(const dst_key_t *key);
681
682uint32_t
683dst_key_flags(const dst_key_t *key);
684
685dns_keytag_t
686dst_key_id(const dst_key_t *key);
687
688dns_keytag_t
689dst_key_rid(const dst_key_t *key);
690
691dns_rdataclass_t
692dst_key_class(const dst_key_t *key);
693
694bool
695dst_key_isprivate(const dst_key_t *key);
696
697bool
698dst_key_iszonekey(const dst_key_t *key);
699
700bool
701dst_key_isnullkey(const dst_key_t *key);
702
703isc_result_t
704dst_key_buildfilename(const dst_key_t *key, int type,
705 const char *directory, isc_buffer_t *out);
706/*%<
707 * Generates the filename used by dst to store the specified key.
708 * If directory is NULL, the current directory is assumed.
709 *
710 * Requires:
711 *\li "key" is a valid key
712 *\li "type" is either DST_TYPE_PUBLIC, DST_TYPE_PRIVATE, or 0 for no suffix.
713 *\li "out" is a valid buffer
714 *
715 * Ensures:
716 *\li the file name will be written to "out", and the used pointer will
717 * be advanced.
718 */
719
720isc_result_t
721dst_key_sigsize(const dst_key_t *key, unsigned int *n);
722/*%<
723 * Computes the size of a signature generated by the given key.
724 *
725 * Requires:
726 *\li "key" is a valid key.
727 *\li "n" is not NULL
728 *
729 * Returns:
730 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
731 *\li DST_R_UNSUPPORTEDALG
732 *
733 * Ensures:
734 *\li "n" stores the size of a generated signature
735 */
736
737isc_result_t
738dst_key_secretsize(const dst_key_t *key, unsigned int *n);
739/*%<
740 * Computes the size of a shared secret generated by the given key.
741 *
742 * Requires:
743 *\li "key" is a valid key.
744 *\li "n" is not NULL
745 *
746 * Returns:
747 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
748 *\li DST_R_UNSUPPORTEDALG
749 *
750 * Ensures:
751 *\li "n" stores the size of a generated shared secret
752 */
753
754uint16_t
755dst_region_computeid(const isc_region_t *source);
756uint16_t
757dst_region_computerid(const isc_region_t *source);
758/*%<
759 * Computes the (revoked) key id of the key stored in the provided
760 * region.
761 *
762 * Requires:
763 *\li "source" contains a valid, non-NULL region.
764 *
765 * Returns:
766 *\li the key id
767 */
768
769uint16_t
770dst_key_getbits(const dst_key_t *key);
771/*%<
772 * Get the number of digest bits required (0 == MAX).
773 *
774 * Requires:
775 * "key" is a valid key.
776 */
777
778void
779dst_key_setbits(dst_key_t *key, uint16_t bits);
780/*%<
781 * Set the number of digest bits required (0 == MAX).
782 *
783 * Requires:
784 * "key" is a valid key.
785 */
786
787void
788dst_key_setttl(dst_key_t *key, dns_ttl_t ttl);
789/*%<
790 * Set the default TTL to use when converting the key
791 * to a KEY or DNSKEY RR.
792 *
793 * Requires:
794 * "key" is a valid key.
795 */
796
797dns_ttl_t
798dst_key_getttl(const dst_key_t *key);
799/*%<
800 * Get the default TTL to use when converting the key
801 * to a KEY or DNSKEY RR.
802 *
803 * Requires:
804 * "key" is a valid key.
805 */
806
807isc_result_t
808dst_key_setflags(dst_key_t *key, uint32_t flags);
809/*
810 * Set the key flags, and recompute the key ID.
811 *
812 * Requires:
813 * "key" is a valid key.
814 */
815
816isc_result_t
817dst_key_getnum(const dst_key_t *key, int type, uint32_t *valuep);
818/*%<
819 * Get a member of the numeric metadata array and place it in '*valuep'.
820 *
821 * Requires:
822 * "key" is a valid key.
823 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_NUMERIC
824 * "timep" is not null.
825 */
826
827void
828dst_key_setnum(dst_key_t *key, int type, uint32_t value);
829/*%<
830 * Set a member of the numeric metadata array.
831 *
832 * Requires:
833 * "key" is a valid key.
834 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_NUMERIC
835 */
836
837void
838dst_key_unsetnum(dst_key_t *key, int type);
839/*%<
840 * Flag a member of the numeric metadata array as "not set".
841 *
842 * Requires:
843 * "key" is a valid key.
844 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_NUMERIC
845 */
846
847isc_result_t
848dst_key_gettime(const dst_key_t *key, int type, isc_stdtime_t *timep);
849/*%<
850 * Get a member of the timing metadata array and place it in '*timep'.
851 *
852 * Requires:
853 * "key" is a valid key.
854 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_TIMES
855 * "timep" is not null.
856 */
857
858void
859dst_key_settime(dst_key_t *key, int type, isc_stdtime_t when);
860/*%<
861 * Set a member of the timing metadata array.
862 *
863 * Requires:
864 * "key" is a valid key.
865 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_TIMES
866 */
867
868void
869dst_key_unsettime(dst_key_t *key, int type);
870/*%<
871 * Flag a member of the timing metadata array as "not set".
872 *
873 * Requires:
874 * "key" is a valid key.
875 * "type" is no larger than DST_MAX_TIMES
876 */
877
878isc_result_t
879dst_key_getprivateformat(const dst_key_t *key, int *majorp, int *minorp);
880/*%<
881 * Get the private key format version number. (If the key does not have
882 * a private key associated with it, the version will be 0.0.) The major
883 * version number is placed in '*majorp', and the minor version number in
884 * '*minorp'.
885 *
886 * Requires:
887 * "key" is a valid key.
888 * "majorp" is not NULL.
889 * "minorp" is not NULL.
890 */
891
892void
893dst_key_setprivateformat(dst_key_t *key, int major, int minor);
894/*%<
895 * Set the private key format version number.
896 *
897 * Requires:
898 * "key" is a valid key.
899 */
900
901#define DST_KEY_FORMATSIZE (DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE + DNS_SECALG_FORMATSIZE + 7)
902
903void
904dst_key_format(const dst_key_t *key, char *cp, unsigned int size);
905/*%<
906 * Write the uniquely identifying information about the key (name,
907 * algorithm, key ID) into a string 'cp' of size 'size'.
908 */
909
910
911isc_buffer_t *
912dst_key_tkeytoken(const dst_key_t *key);
913/*%<
914 * Return the token from the TKEY request, if any. If this key was
915 * not negotiated via TKEY, return NULL.
916 *
917 * Requires:
918 * "key" is a valid key.
919 */
920
921
922isc_result_t
923dst_key_dump(dst_key_t *key, isc_mem_t *mctx, char **buffer, int *length);
924/*%<
925 * Allocate 'buffer' and dump the key into it in base64 format. The buffer
926 * is not NUL terminated. The length of the buffer is returned in *length.
927 *
928 * 'buffer' needs to be freed using isc_mem_put(mctx, buffer, length);
929 *
930 * Requires:
931 * 'buffer' to be non NULL and *buffer to be NULL.
932 * 'length' to be non NULL and *length to be zero.
933 *
934 * Returns:
935 * ISC_R_SUCCESS
936 * ISC_R_NOMEMORY
937 * ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED
938 * others.
939 */
940
941isc_result_t
942dst_key_restore(dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg, unsigned int flags,
943 unsigned int protocol, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
944 isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *keystr, dst_key_t **keyp);
945
946bool
947dst_key_inactive(const dst_key_t *key);
948/*%<
949 * Determines if the private key is missing due the key being deemed inactive.
950 *
951 * Requires:
952 * 'key' to be valid.
953 */
954
955void
956dst_key_setinactive(dst_key_t *key, bool inactive);
957/*%<
958 * Set key inactive state.
959 *
960 * Requires:
961 * 'key' to be valid.
962 */
963
964void
965dst_key_setexternal(dst_key_t *key, bool value);
966
967bool
968dst_key_isexternal(dst_key_t *key);
969
970ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS

972#endif /* DST_DST_H */
